A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: While not terrible\, Last Jedi did a very poor job of following up The Force Awakens.   After 2.5 hours\, The Last Jedi rolls credits and deflates the momentum which had been generated by the previous film.   \n\nIn many ways\, I enjoyed Last Jedi\, but it also frustrated me.  It frustrated me because there are a few points when it feels like the Star Wars movie I wanted\, but then those moments are quickly washed away by odd storytelling choices and a seemingly hostile attitude toward any and all of what Star Wars had been prior to the film.   Despite enjoying the film\, I cannot say that I felt it delivered Tyne experience I wanted\, and I do not feel confident in the future quality of the franchise.
